@pnkfelix you're the only one I see regularly using different directories when running x.py. What do you think about sharing a build cache (not a config.toml) between directories? That would avoid having to recompile everything whenever you move to a new directory.

(See also https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/71994#issuecomment-625500054; originally that PR changed all x.py invocations to use the top-level build/ directory.)
Would the cache be smart enough to not reuse objects that resulted from differing configurations? Otherwise I donâ€™t see how that makes things simpler ?
Hmm, what if it shared the cache only when there's no config file in the current directory? I guess you might not use that often but I could see other people doing so.
Probably this is very low priority, it just bugs me :laughing:
